Roger Thornhill.Action: Invites Maggie to lunch and insists she walk despite her weary moan, pushing her to 'use your blood sugar.'
Buys a newspaper at the newsstand and thoughtfully suggests sending candy to Gretchen Sabinson, indicating considerate behavior.
Greets Herman Weltner and others politely with handshakes and introductions.
Shows nervousness and impatience while waiting in the bar, looking about nervously.
Politely greets and shakes hands with his contacts despite being late; acknowledges others respectfully.
Looks about nervously after sitting down.
Engages in light banter indicating confidence ('Won't last for long').
Shows concern for his mother, tries to find a way to contact her despite inconvenience.
Interrupts others politely, asks bellboy for help in sending telegram.
Gives a tip to the bellboy and thanks him sincerely.
Responds with confusion and some irritation when confronted by strangers threatening him.
Politely asks the men if he can be let off briefly to notify people waiting for him, showing consideration for others.
Tries to escape by lunging at the locked car door, but does so quietly without causing a disturbance.
Attempts to open the locked car door to escape when the car stops at a red light.
Tries to negotiate with the kidnappers by asking them to let him off to call his acquaintances.
Appears anxious but tries not to show it.
After the failed escape attempt, he sheepishly resigns to his situation and sits back down quietly.
Glances questioningly at the men when receiving no answers, showing engagement and tolerance.
Attempts light banter by asking what is for dessert, possibly to ease tension or be friendly.
Passively follows the men without asserting himself despite unclear situation, showing restraint but possible detachment.
Indicates he will catch up on his reading in the locked room, tries to open the door and window to escape, takes the man's hand uncertainly when greeted.
Takes the man's hand uncertainly upon greeting.
Speaks with bite and sarcasm when addressing Mr. Townsend.
Admits to being upset about missing theatre tickets and expresses frustration reasonably.
Smiles when making a witty remark about mistaken identity.
Firmly insists on his true identity despite others' ignoring it.
Takes the stranger's hand uncertainly.
Responds with sarcastic and biting remarks despite being uncertain of the situation.
Attempts to assert his own identity firmly when mistaken for someone else.
Maintains a polite but wary tone, trying to understand why he was brought there.
Jokes about the mistaken identity in a way that defuses tension.
Allows others to address him by the wrong name and plays along before correcting them.
Responds with sarcasm to the woman bringing dinner, indicating irritation but no hostility.
Politely but firmly denies being 'Kaplan' and asserts identity, maintaining composure under pressure.
Engages with the men seriously and maintains a sarcastic tone, showing wit but guardedness.
Expresses skepticism about the offer to survive the evening, indicating caution and self-preservation.
Politely indicates intention to leave and head to the theatre, avoiding confrontation.
Attempts to reason calmly with Leonard, telling him he is making a serious mistake.
Frankly and tersely denies all accusations and identities assigned to him, showing frustration but no hostility.
Firmly asserts his true identity (not Kaplan), challenges mistaken identity confidently.
Provides logical reasoning by mentioning his identification cards to prove identity.
Remains frustrated and helpless when confronted with fabricated evidence and false accusations.
Does not find or propose an effective solution to counter the fabricated evidence or escape the situation.
Politely refuses a drink offered under coercion, trying to maintain composure.
Attempts to avoid confrontation and not escalate situation despite being held and pressured.
Refuses to cooperate because he claims ignorance of their accusations despite pressure.
Tries to refuse the offered alcohol and attempts to leave when threatened, but is physically restrained.
Sings drunkenly and mumbles in the Mercedes Benz, lightly joking with others ('Don’t worry about me, fellahs. I’ll take the bus from here.')
Is found mumbling and singing drunkenly, apparently not fully aware or in control of the situation.
Despite apparent intoxication, agrees to take the bus, showing some situational awareness and acceptance of circumstance.
Is physically helped into the driver’s seat by others and not shown taking independent action to control or direct events.
Shoves Valerian out of the car to save himself from the precipice.
Grasps the wheel and drives the car to safety despite the danger.
Shoves Valerian out of the car and takes control of the wheel to prevent going off the precipice.
Drives recklessly at high speed while delirious and only slightly aware of the danger.
Slams on brakes abruptly to avoid hitting an elderly bicyclist despite high-speed chase.
Drives recklessly at high speed, weaving dangerously through traffic, risking others' safety.
Drives recklessly at very high speeds, weaving wildly through traffic and swerving dangerously, causing hazard to himself and others.
Despite extreme stress and dangerous driving conditions, manages to keep eyes in focus, foot on floorboard, and hands on the wheel, maintaining control of the vehicle.
Reactively slams on brakes to avoid hitting an elderly bicyclist who appeared suddenly, preventing a potentially fatal accident.
Fails to recognize the pursuing vehicle has changed from a limousine to a police car, indicating some lack of situational awareness.
Thanks the police officers for their help despite being drunk and distressed.
Insists someone call the police and tries to communicate important information about danger to himself.
Shows signs of distrust or paranoia by stating 'They tried to kill me' and resisting authority.
Calls his mother from the police station, tries to explain he was forced to drink, shows concern for how his mother perceives him.
Insists on finishing his phone call despite interruption, showing some persistence and sincerity in communication.
Reassures his mother over the phone by saying 'Don't worry. I'm all right, Mother.'
Tries to explain his situation to Dr. Cross showing some frustration but attempts sincerity.
Responds with a witty or sarcastic remark about operating the motor vehicle 'Admirably.'
Responds cooperatively and with a bit of humor during the medical examination despite being intoxicated and restrained.
Shows little explicit friendliness or concern toward others in this excerpt; mostly focused on his own predicament.
Attempts to negotiate a balance test despite being intoxicated, shows some awareness of his condition but cannot fully control it.
Refuses insulin and mouthwash, insists he never touched 'the stuff', showing some knowledge but possibly evasiveness or confusion.
Responds with humor and sarcasm to the doctor ('How disgusting') and shows some composure under investigation.
Fails to respond adequately to the doctor's repeated questions and struggles to stay conscious, lying down on the table.
Smiles feebly at his mother despite her not smiling back.
Turns and whispers angrily 'Mother!' when she sniffs scorn at his attorney’s defense.
Turns and gives his mother an angry look when she shows disbelief in his story.
After a rough night in jail, appears disheveled and stands weakly in court, smiling feebly at his mother who does not respond positively.
Escapes from would-be assassins and tries to drive away under dangerous conditions but is unable to handle the circumstances well, leading to his capture and court appearance.
Gives his mother an angry look when she expresses disbelief in his story, showing some assertiveness and emotional awareness.
Argues quietly but sarcastically with his mother during a tense situation, showing strained family interaction.
Speaks indignantly in court, implying frustration at being disbelieved, indicating sincerity in defending himself.
Argues indignantly in court, trying to defend his story but comes across as defensive and frustrated.
Engages in a calm, somewhat witty verbal exchange with his mother while being transported by detectives, showing composure and quick thinking.
Quietly argues with his mother in a somewhat sarcastic but familiar manner, showing a candid and informal family relationship.
Uses sarcasm toward his mother about cheating at bridge and supports her friends, indicating a playful but supportive interaction.
Speaks indignantly in court, insisting on his honesty and truthfulness despite skepticism.
Argues quietly and humorously with his mother, maintaining composure under stress, while being under suspicion and en route to investigation.
Indignantly challenges the judge's implication of his dishonesty, showing confidence in his own narrative.
Allows others to dominate the situation (County Detectives, Larrabee, Judge) without assertively directing his own defense or investigation.
Greets the housekeeper cheerfully and with a satisfied grin.
Leads the detectives respectfully and points out stains on the sofa to assist the investigation.
Frowns and looks around the room carefully, showing attentiveness but also some frustration.
Satisfied recognition upon the housekeeper remembering him and confidently directs the group to the library and points out supposed bourbon stains.
Examines the seat cushion carefully, shows increasing concern by frowning and turning it over, but then incorrectly assumes liquor is stored in the cabinet without verifying before opening it.
Whips open cabinet expecting liquor but finds only books, indicating a hasty or premature conclusion.
Jokes charmingly to deflect attention, though falsely denies knowing the woman.
Appears astounded and somewhat embarrassed by woman's familiarity and concern.
Hopelessly admits not borrowing a car, shows some honesty under pressure.
Straightens up and tries to respond quickly when approached by the woman, attempting to appear in control.
Denies knowing the woman from the night before to assert his innocence and control the situation.
Admits hopelessly that he did not borrow the car but does not convincingly defend himself against allegations.
Accuses the woman of lying abruptly.
Shows desperation and concern by trying to redirect suspicion to the woman's husband.
Uses sardonic admiration ('What a performance!') to comment on the woman's explanation.
Questions the lack of further action from Captain Junket about the situation, showing awareness and concern.
Looks to his mother for guidance and ultimately accepts her advice to pay the two dollars, showing some hesitation but willingness to comply.
Exits without engaging in further confrontation despite being dissatisfied, indicating restraint or lack of assertiveness.
Savage sarcasm towards his mother regarding her presence lending respectability, revealing confidence but also possible recklessness or emotional impulsiveness.
Proactively uses a house phone at the hotel to inquire about George Kaplan, showing initiative and problem-solving behavior.
Encourages his mother to use her charm to ask for a hotel room key, offers her bribes playfully, watches her with a mix of amusement and concern.
Shows concern about George Kaplan's whereabouts and safety, involving his mother in a somewhat playful but caring manner.
Uses humor to lighten tense situations, e.g., correcting 'house-breaking' to 'hotel-breaking' with a smile.
Calmly verifies George Kaplan's hotel registration and phone status, attempts to gather information methodically.
Plans to have his mother ask for the hotel room key using charm and money, showing strategic thinking and resourcefulness.
Watches his mother approach the desk and accompanies her to the hotel room, taking initiative and remaining cautious.
Clarifies the distinction between house-breaking and hotel-breaking, showing attention to detail and understanding of the situation.
Responds politely and appreciatively to the chambermaid's offer to change linens.
Acts nervously and tensely when interacting with hotel staff, showing no impatience or rudeness.
Tries to reassure his mother by telling her 'Don't be nervous, Mother.'
Engages playfully with the maid Elsie, asking her questions and responding to her giggles.
Makes a teasing, somewhat sarcastic remark about Mr. Kaplan having dandruff.
Inspects the comb carefully and replaces it without disturbing anything, showing attention to detail and situational awareness.
Questions the maid about how she knows he is Mr. Kaplan, indicating a strategic attempt to gather information.
Uses the name 'Mr. Kaplan' to maintain his cover, demonstrating quick thinking under pressure.
Calls the chambermaid to the room, potentially alerting others to his presence or disturbance.
Gives a tip to the valet and thanks him politely.
Exchanges a look with his mother while valet hangs suit.
Questions valet casually about the suit without suspicion or rudeness.
Notices the discrepancy about the suit, questions the valet, and inspects the suits personally.
Does not immediately realize the deeper implications of the valet's inconsistent story about the suit or the identity confusion.
Engages in phone conversation cautiously, shows concern about the caller who tried to kill him last night.
Answers mysterious phone call despite uncertainty and advisement not to.
Responds to Mrs. Thornhill with some irritation when she dismisses the threat as unimportant.
Uncertain whether to answer phone but picks it up despite advice not to.
Answers call from unknown person, tries to get information from operator quickly.
Mistakenly assumes he is not recognized, shows some confusion about identity.
Takes his mother by the arm and hurries her to safety, showing concern for her well-being.
Nods insistently to convince his mother about the danger despite her disbelief, showing sincerity and a desire to protect.
Politely lets ladies exit elevator first by saying 'Ladies first, if you don't mind'
Stands glowering while others laugh, showing emotional distance
After the elevator stops, Thornhill quickly shifts to furtive calculation, politely ushers ladies out first, and then makes a speedy escape by running toward the exit and getting into a taxi.
Stands glowering in the midst of growing laughter without immediately responding, showing some hesitation before taking action.
Asks the cab driver to 'do something' about being followed, trusting the driver to help calmly and politely.
Acknowledges the presence of an Indian girl at the information desk and engages her with polite, straightforward questions.
Dashes out of the hotel abruptly and jumps into a cab past startled onlookers, showing disregard for others' comfort or social norms.
Recognizes he is being followed, remains calm, thinks through situation using clues (torn photograph), and directs cab to a strategic location (United Nations).
Asks the cab driver to intervene against followers, showing resourcefulness and quick thinking.
Does not appear to have a clear destination initially ('I don't know. Just keep going.').
Politely thanks the girl at the Information Desk for her help.
Hesitates when asked his name and uses an assumed name, showing nervousness but not outright deception or hostility.
Hesitates when asked for his name and uses the alias 'George Kaplan' indicating quick thinking to protect identity.
Appears nervous glancing back toward the entrance door, showing lack of confidence in a tense situation.
Follows instructions carefully by taking the slip and preparing to give it to an attendant in the Public Lounge, demonstrating attentiveness and adherence to procedure.
Politely requests the attendant to page Mr. Townsend and waits patiently in a crowded room.
Politely informs the attendant that the man presented is not Mr. Townsend, showing honesty and clarity.
Approaches the attendant confidently and correctly requests to page Mr. Lester Townsend, showing initiative and understanding of procedure.
Waits attentively for Mr. Townsend’s appearance, ignores other irrelevant interruptions, demonstrating focus and patience.
Fails initially to recognize the real Mr. Townsend, confusing him with a stranger; shows momentary puzzlement.
Shakes Townsend’s hand dumbly and engages in polite conversation despite confusion.
Puts his arms around Townsend to support him when Townsend suddenly faints or weakens.
Shakes Townsend's hand dumbly and is utterly bewildered during the interaction, showing confusion and lack of control of the situation.
Attempts to clarify the situation by asking Townsend direct questions about his whereabouts and the people living in the house, demonstrating some initiative and investigative instinct.
Automatically supports Townsend when he suddenly collapses, showing quick physical responsiveness and presence of mind in a moment of crisis.
Instinctively pulls out the knife from Townsend's back to help or see what happened.
Stands in horror and confusion at the scene of the killing, showing shock and distress.
Begs the crowd to listen and asserts his innocence, showing a desire to be understood and honest despite fear.
Threatens the crowd to stay back in fear, holding a bloody knife, which could be seen as defensive but also intimidating.
Drops the knife and flees the scene out of panic and confusion, showing vulnerability but avoiding confrontation.
Instinctively grasps and pulls out the knife from Townsend's back when he is stabbed.
Freezes in horror and confusion, dazed and backing away from accusing crowd instead of asserting innocence strongly.
Attempts to verbally explain his innocence despite panic and crowd pressure.
Drops the knife and flees from the scene before onlookers can act.
Provides a false name (George Kaplan) to an attendant.
Attempts to investigate George Kaplan's whereabouts by calling hotels and trying to gather information despite personal risk.
Refuses to go to the police because of his compromised situation, showing awareness of his precarious position.
His fingerprints are on the knife and he is implicated as a drunk driver, car thief, and murderer — indicating he is caught in circumstances suggesting poor personal judgment or bad luck.
Exasperated tone and impatient listening on the phone suggest stress and some difficulty managing the situation calmly.
Responds sarcastically to his mother and hangs up the phone abruptly.
Uses dark glasses and acts cautiously in a tense situation, showing wariness.
Impatiently insists on getting a bedroom ticket and deflects the ticket agent's questions with sharp remarks.
Attempts to move through the train platform gate by politely explaining his intention to see friends off.
Withdraws to a vantage point and observes others discreetly, possibly indicating mistrust or cautiousness.
Yanks arm free from guard, pushes him aside, and runs past others in urgent escape.
Engages in polite, reciprocal apologies with the girl as they awkwardly try to pass each other in a narrow aisle.
Discreetly ducks into a luggage compartment partially closing the door to avoid police, showing no apparent distress or selfishness towards the girl.
Thanks the girl who points out the direction to the police, albeit lamely.
Looks after the girl after she walks away, noticing the attractive view.
Steps out cautiously from the luggage compartment, checks that the coast is clear before moving forward.
Thanks the girl awkwardly after she helps him, mentions seven parking tickets lamely, showing some social awkwardness.
Peers out of the train window watching the police helplessly as they fail to catch the suspect, indicating a lack of control over the situation.
Returns the girl's smile reflectingly and smiles back at her, engaging in light friendly interaction during the meal.
Casually turns over the newspaper with his picture on the front page without any visible emotional reaction.
Engages in light, somewhat playful conversation with the girl, responding to her honesty and teasing remarks.
Admits feeling nervous and self-conscious, showing vulnerability.
Mentions that when he meets an attractive girl, he has to pretend he does not desire her, fearing objection.
Engages in playful, lighthearted banter with Eve Kendall; shows openness by initiating introductions.
Responds modestly and self-deprecatingly when Eve exposes his real identity.
Shares a moment of mutual understanding and relaxed interaction with Eve, indicating trust.
Strikes a match to light her cigarette, finds her touch delightful.
Engages in light-hearted banter about sleeping arrangements and pajamas with Eve.
Shows slight awe and attentiveness when Eve puts money on her tab and leaves.
Observes concerning events (men from police car) silently without alerting Eve.
Strikes a match skillfully to light a cigarette for Eve, showing calmness and social grace in a somewhat tense situation.
Admits to having no bedroom or ticket and has been playing hide-and-seek with the conductor, indicating a lack of preparation or planning.
Engages in witty, confident banter with Eve about the train accommodations, showing quick thinking and social confidence.
As the train makes an unscheduled stop and notices men from a police car on the platform, he just stares and does not take immediate action or express clear strategic thinking.
Puts money on the table before leaving, indicating a polite gesture paying for something.
Reassures Eve by telling her to tell the police to hurry, showing concern for the situation.
Maintains a light, humorous tone despite being locked in an upper berth, indicating friendliness and ease.
Remains hidden and does not intervene directly while Eve faces the detectives, showing trust and giving her space.
Chats politely and innocuously with Eve about food and travel despite being a fugitive.
Does not disclose identity or situation to Eve, maintaining distance and secrecy.
Smiles with friendly puzzlement at Eve after she helps him escape from the locked berth.
Murmurs affectionately to Eve and engages in frequent kisses, standing close and holding her at the waist.
Expresses weak, pleading humor ('Either hurry, or bring me a snorkel') showing vulnerability and reliance on Eve.
Succeeds in escaping a locked berth using a can opener key device, emerging with a sigh of relief and good humor despite his broken sunglasses.
Uses humor ('Either hurry, or bring me a snorkel') and maintains friendly engagement during a stressful situation, showing composure.
Does not demonstrate any decisive or strategic action against the threat implied by the detective's presence; mostly reactive rather than proactive.
Expresses concern for Eve's safety by insisting she not get involved due to danger.
Engages in flirtatious and playful kissing and teasing with Eve, showing warmth and charm.
Dismisses Eve's desire to know more about him by saying 'the rest is unimportant', showing some withholding of sincerity.
Insists on protecting Eve by not letting her roam Chicago looking for George Kaplan, recognizing the danger.
Engages in playful, flirtatious banter rather than focusing on the serious situation at hand.
Acknowledges the uncertainty about his own trustworthiness honestly when Eve questions if he might be a murderer.
Defers detailed disclosure about himself, prioritizing secrecy in a dangerous situation.
Engages in a playful, flirtatious exchange with Eve, expressing appreciation for her 'flavor' and sharing a long kiss.
Steps quickly inside the lavatory to give Eve privacy when the porter arrives, respecting her space and the situation.
Looks at his own reflection with a blank expression after observing Eve's toiletries, showing introspection but no overt emotional expression.
Holds Eve gently and shares a tender kiss, engages in light-hearted, playful banter about the shared bed being a good omen.
Opens the door promptly when called, shows attentiveness and responsiveness.
Notices the open bed and turns off the overhead lights, demonstrating awareness and quick decision-making.
Interacts confidently and smoothly with Eve, maintaining control of the situation.
Makes a light comment about 'only one bed' and interprets it as a good omen, showing an ability to keep the mood positive and light.
Uses humor and charm effectively in communication with Eve.
No hesitation or confusion shown when confronted with subtle social cues from Eve.
Follows Eve through the crowded train platform, keeping pace confidently.
Responds promptly to Eve's direction without hesitation ('Yes, ma'am').
Allows Eve to confront the detectives alone, continuing on instead of intervening.
Engages in light-hearted banter with Eve while struggling with heavy luggage, showing a touch of humor despite exhaustion.
Insists on making the phone call himself rather than having Eve do it, showing initiative but also a slight mistrust or desire to control.
Compliments Eve by calling her the smartest girl he spent a night with on a train.
Gives Eve a sour look after complimenting her, showing a complex emotional response.
Maintains a cheerful, alert demeanor looking out for danger ahead, suggesting protectiveness and attentiveness.
Directs Eve clearly and acts with urgency to arrange a meeting, showing decisiveness.
Questions the practicality of changing clothes in an awkward place, showing situational awareness and pragmatism.
Maintains a cheerful attitude while being alert for danger, balancing confidence and vigilance.
Relies on Eve's judgment and compliments her intelligence, showing respect and openness to support.
Makes a sarcastic/sour look instead of addressing concerns seriously, potentially undermining interpersonal dynamics.
Casually watches detectives entering men's room, does not reveal himself or try to draw attention.
Is indistinguishable among many similar men in a crowd, blending in without attracting attention.
Removes Redcap uniform and attempts to disguise himself to avoid detection.
Passively waits and watches detectives enter the men's room, showing a calm demeanor under pressure.
Although under pursuit, Thornhill maintains composure and uses available resources (clothing, bag) to aid in avoiding capture.
Nonchalantly finishes lathering with Eve's razor, showing casualness and comfort in an unusual situation.
Carries Eve's small zippered bag and gives her a deliberate side glance meaning 'Follow me'.
Nonchalantly finishes lathering and subtly uses Eve's tiny razor, maintaining calm and composure despite the ongoing situation.
Carries Eve's small zippered bag and walks with assumed nonchalance across the station, giving a deliberate side glance signaling stealthy coordination.
Carries Eve's small zippered bag and waits for her patiently at a secluded spot
Engages cooperatively in the conversation with Eve, attentively receiving instructions and expressing concern for her tension

Speaks with tenderness expressing gratitude to Eve despite the tension.
Grasps Eve and asks her to wait, showing desperation but also a gentle concern.
Dashes off alone despite uncertainty and isolation, showing resilience but little social warmth in this moment.
Dashes off quickly when sensing danger despite limited visibility, showing situational awareness and urgency.
Stands alone in the middle of nowhere after exiting the bus, suggesting vulnerability and potential lack of preparation.
Stands alone in harsh, desolate surroundings, calmly observing and enduring discomfort without complaint.
Glances about, studies his surroundings carefully, checks his watch repeatedly, observes approaching vehicles and the environment.
Sweats and shows nervousness under pressure, indicating possible unease or stress in a dangerous situation.
Wipes his face nervously but remains observant and focused on the man across the highway, showing alertness without aggression.
Watches the man and the approaching plane silently without engaging or showing hostility.
Moves off the highway quickly to avoid the large moving van.
Watches the man across the highway carefully, maintaining vigilance and focus.
Wipes his face but does not take his eyes off the man, showing awareness and composure under pressure.
Stares with mounting interest at the low-flying plane, possibly indicating cautious observation.
Crosses over and initiates conversation with a stranger on a hot day, attempting friendly small talk.
Looks to warn or say something to the stranger as the bus pulls away, but remains silent and alone.
Waves his arms wildly on the highway to intercept the approaching Diesel tanker, trying to get its attention to avoid danger.
Hurls himself to the pavement in front of the Diesel truck to stop it and prevent further disaster.
Leaves the scene of the crash without helping or communicating with others, and steals the farmer's truck to escape.
Asks hotel clerk politely for information about George Kaplan's room.
Talks half to himself and then dismisses the clerk when questioned.
Watches police carefully from concealment, showing awareness and caution.
Approaches hotel and calmly requests information at front desk, demonstrating purposeful behavior.
Questions clerk’s information about Kaplan checking out, indicating critical thinking.
Appears disheveled and out of place, suit not fitting social setting.
Watches Eve unobserved without intrusive behavior, then politely asks the clerk for her room number.
Approaches Eve's door with suspicion and caution, listens before buzzing, then greets her pleasantly and enters the room.
Responds to Eve's embrace by placing his hands on her but without genuine warmth; internally acknowledges liking her 'a little bit' but remains guarded and somewhat calculating.
Acknowledges his anger and tendency to say incautious things, indicating self-awareness of his conflicting feelings toward Eve.
Initiates casual conversation and shares a drink with Eve, showing tolerance and a degree of friendly interaction despite complications.
His darting glance quickly surveys the room and the open bathroom door, yet notices nothing worthy of apprehension.
He intends to play it cool despite feeling deep down anger, showing some control over his emotions in a tense situation.
Says incautious things he ought not to say if he intends to disarm Eve, occasionally being warmer than intended, indicating a lack of complete emotional control.
Orders his scotch with water and no ice, demonstrating clear preferences and composure.
Casually saunters over to a chair where a newspaper with a headline about a plane crash lies, showing a calm demeanor under pressure.
Playfully teases Eve about the directions and shares a drink with her, toasting to a long-lasting friendship and expressing intent to keep her in sight.
Stares at Eve’s back after she turns away, showing some persistence but no apparent hostility or impatience.
Maintains casual demeanor while discussing a failed meeting, showing composure under uncertain circumstances.
Acknowledges uncertainty about next steps openly, admitting he hasn't made up his mind yet.
Uses charm and social skill to engage Eve as an ally, indicating social competence and confidence.
Does not immediately escalate or react impulsively to the failed meeting or unexpected absence, suggesting thoughtful restraint.
Relies on Eve to help decide next course of action, indicating some dependence rather than fully independent problem solving.
Smiles softly and speaks of togetherness, implying desire to stay close and connected.
Allows Eve to answer the phone despite his interest, showing respect for her space.
Says 'all work and no play,' encouraging Eve to enjoy herself rather than focus solely on business.
Touches Eve's waist despite her discomfort, invading her personal space.
Observes Eve's phone conversation attentively and closely without interrupting or revealing his interest overtly.
Takes a long drag on his drink and speaks deliberately, indicating control and confidence.
Saunters around the room to appear casual despite keen interest.
Does not intervene when Eve answers the phone or avoid appearing suspicious, showing social tact and patience.
Insists on having dinner with Eve despite her clear discomfort and refusal, ignoring her explicit request to leave immediately.
Maintains a firm but fair stance on conditions (dinner first), showing some respect for boundaries despite pressure.
Responds unperturbed and without anger to Eve’s rejection, showing emotional control and sincerity in his persistence.
Cautiously plans his next move, showing concern.
Engages in playful, intimate interaction with Eve, showing softness and trust.
Gently questions Eve with a warm tone, showing genuine interest and affection.
Thinks fast, cautiously checks his surroundings before using the phone to arrange a quick suit cleaning service.
Initially hesitates to pick up the phone but overcomes it and acts purposefully.
Plays along with Eve in a seemingly relaxed, confident manner despite the tense situation.
Jokes teasingly and pats Eve's cheek in a playful, friendly manner.
Sings loudly in the shower while secretly watching Eve's suspicious actions, showing a lack of trust or invasion of privacy.
While pretending to take a shower, he cleverly disguises his observation of Eve's suspicious actions from behind the bathroom door.
Makes a risky and somewhat inappropriate comment to Eve, quickly correcting himself when he realizes it was too far.
Fails to physically conceal himself fully and allows Eve to notice his unusual behavior, potentially compromising his position.
Peering out at Eve's furtive activities while singing lustily, showing a playful and non-judgmental attitude.
Reads the memo Eve left and investigates the meaning, demonstrating engagement and trust in pursuing the clues.
Frowns puzzled at the address but still decides to enter the gallery and proceed with caution and curiosity.
Anticipates Eve's furtive activities and is prepared to uncover her secret, showing he has been ahead of her game all along.
Deciphers the hidden message by discerning the indentation from the pencil and reads the address.
Confidently travels to the address from the clue and investigates the location despite initial puzzlement.
Expresses tenderness and gratitude to Eve before parting, showing sincere appreciation.
Notices Eve's tension and shows concern by asking about her feelings.
Frowns and appears puzzled when confronted with puzzling information, indicating thoughtfulness but no clear warmth or coldness.
Speaks with tenderness to Eve, acknowledging his failure to properly thank her.
Makes a bitter, sarcastic remark to Eve about saying something before her.
Makes a quick sarcastic comment (a quick shaft) at Leonard.
Shows contempt when responding 'Sure. Isn't everybody?' about following Eve to her room.
Bitterly tries to interject during auction but is ignored; shows sarcasm and bitterness rather than strategic action.
Responds to Vandamm's accusation with a quick sarcastic retort about survival and drunks.
Follows Eve from hotel to auction without a clear plan, resulting in displeasure from Vandamm.
Displays contempt but does not take concrete or effective action to advance position or protect himself.
Teases Vandamm by saying he collects corpses, not art.
Compliments Eve on her sculpture and defends its value.
Compliments Eve's dedication and sincerity in her work, acknowledging she puts her heart into it.
Responds subtly and with a quick glance when Vandamm's name is mentioned, indicating guardedness rather than openness.
Reacts cautiously and attentively to the mention of Vandamm’s name, indicating alertness and situational awareness.
Engages in banter with Leonard, asking a somewhat sarcastic question about the curio cabinet.
Responds with a chilly smile and sarcastic remarks when accused of being a peevish lover, showing guardedness and detachment.
Watches Vandamm leave while making wry comments about his potential fate, indicating a dry humor but emotional distance.
Looks at Eve and questions whether she will kiss him again to poison him, showing distrust and suspicion rather than warmth.
Responds with dry wit and ironic remarks despite threatening circumstances.
Expresses dark humor about potential ways he might be killed, indicating awareness of danger.
Does not immediately escape or fight back, but rather engages verbally and theatrically.
Presses Eve back into her seat firmly during their altercation and speaks with contempt about her having no feelings to hurt.
Challenges Vandamm defiantly, implying distrust and suspicion rather than friendliness or trust.
Says 'Goodnight, sweetheart. Don't think it hasn't been nice.' to Eve, showing a tone of ironic or possibly sarcastic farewell rather than sincere affection.
Looks about with desperation and quickly slips into a nearby seat among spectators to avoid confrontation.
Shouts a lower bid at an ongoing auction, drawing angry attention from others.
Notices the assassin waiting for him, looks about desperately, and quickly slips into a nearby seat among spectators to avoid detection.
Interrupts the auction by shouting a much lower bid than the current high bid, causing anger and confusion among attendees.
Mocks or challenges the auctioneer and other attendees by loudly disputing bids and questioning authenticity, despite others’ clear annoyance.
Responds politely with 'Thank you' after being insulted by the elderly woman.
Interrupts auction with incorrect bids and challenges authenticity of an item loudly, irritating others and showing poor social awareness.
Acknowledges being called an idiot with a sarcastic 'Thank you,' showing quick wit but possibly masking lack of tact.
Hauls back and punches the attendant on the jaw after being pushed into the aisle.
Flashes an apologetic smile to Valerian as he is dragged by the police.
Jokes with the police about being valuable property while being put into the patrol car.
Physically defends himself by landing a punch and wrestling an attacker to the floor quickly and effectively.
Quips to police officers during being dragged away, showing calmness and attempting to maintain some control of the situation.
Does not escape or resist more effectively despite clearly being in a compromising position and under suspicion.
Thanks the officers for saving his life, attempts to lighten the mood with good cheer and smiles.
Displays smug expression while being recognized by the police and during the phone call to headquarters.
Insists on going to police headquarters despite officers' initial directions, showing assertiveness and clear communication.
Grumbles about being tired and asks to sit down politely.
Engages politely with the Professor, asks for his name, tries to clarify misunderstandings calmly.
Slows down to accommodate the Professor’s pace, showing patience.
Makes an effort to clear his name regarding the United Nations killings, implying sincerity.

Slows down when the Professor bumps a passerby, showing social awareness and control over own actions.
Engages in conversation with the professor patiently despite suspicion.
Expresses venom towards Vanden, calling him treacherous.
Shows curiosity and concern about the plot and people involved.
Glances sharply and peers at the Professor with suspicion; protests and argues about the existence of George Kaplan.
Vigorously refuses to continue dangerous decoy role, citing personal responsibilities and unwillingness to be used as bait.
Rejects Professor's appeal with bluntness and sarcasm, though refuses to be manipulated.
Acknowledges his own faults indirectly by sarcastically saying 'Thanks to me' regarding creating suspicion.
Vigorously refuses to participate in a dangerous plan, asserting his personal boundaries and priorities.
Appears uncertain when shaking the Professor's hand after refusing the mission.
Dismisses the espionage role and insists on normal life responsibilities, showing self-awareness but possibly underestimating the situation.
Expresses harsh judgment ('using sex like a fly-swatter') and sneers when questioned about Miss Kendall's motives.
Eyes filled with emotion, shakes head slowly showing pain and confusion over the situation.
Savagely confronts the Professor about using sex as a weapon and the attempt on his life, showing emotional intensity and moral clarity.
Shakes his head slowly, struggling internally with confused feelings and the pain of the situation, showing vulnerability but also deep thought.
Ultimately makes a determined decision despite emotional confusion, indicated by the symbolized arrival of the plane and mounting determination.
Speaks uneasily about feeling watched by the monument (Teddy Roosevelt) and shows restlessness and concern about the situation.
Engages in friendly, if slightly tense, banter with the Professor, debating responsibility and feelings for Miss Kendall with mild humor.
Uses binoculars to vigilantly observe the surroundings at Mt. Rushmore, showing a level of alertness and preparation.
Expresses unease and distraction ('I don't like the way Teddy Roosevelt is looking at me...'), indicating some self-doubt or anxiety.
Questions the professor about the situation, engaging in dialogue to understand the difficulties he faces, indicating thoughtfulness and willingness to confront problems.
Restlessly paces away from the binoculars and professor, exhibiting nervousness and discomfort in the situation.
Shows annoyance but honors a previous bargain with the Professor, demonstrating a sense of responsibility and commitment to promises made.
Reacts tensely and locks off by himself after stating 'My blessings on you Greek only,' showing some irritation and possible impatience.
Observes Vandamn and others quietly and then proceeds purposefully toward the cafeteria, indicating a reserved and somewhat cautious demeanor.
Offers to protect the girl by making a deal with Vandamm, showing concern for her wellbeing.
Speaks with bitterness and anger about the girl's situation, showing emotional engagement.
Attempting to negotiate with an adversary to save the girl from harm, indicating a protective nature.
Confronts Vandamm with specific knowledge of his plans, attempting to negotiate on his terms.
Demands the girl from Vandamm and threatens to pin crimes on her, showing confidence and calculated risk.
Shifts from personal anger to strategic negotiation, demonstrating emotional control and tactical thinking.
Claims he does not deduce but observe, implying careful attention to detail and grounded reasoning.
Rises with concern on his face seeing Eve leave tense; tries to stop her from going with Vandamm and Leonard, intervening physically by grabbing her arm to pull her back.
Pulls Eve violently away from others to prevent her from leaving, then lunges at her despite her pointing a gun at him.
Lunges at Eve despite her pointing a gun at him, resulting in being shot and falling to the floor.
Rises promptly when addressed, approaches Eve and regards her with uncertainty but openness.
Stands silently and gazes uncertainly at Eve, indicating hesitation but willingness to connect.
Does not exhibit dismissiveness or hostility in the scene; remains composed and attentive.
Rises with alacrity from the stretcher when addressed, stands and looks off carefully before proceeding.
Slides out of the ambulance and starts forward slowly, showing measured behavior and awareness of surroundings.
Exchanges uncertain, tentative looks with Eve upon realizing her identity, indicating some hesitation and uncertainty.
Engages in tentative, sincere conversation with Eve, expressing understanding and eventually apologizing for harsh words.
Initially responds without feeling and with slight bitterness to Eve's apology.
Shows eagerness and tenderness in final admission of being hurt, indicating honest emotional expression.
Responds cautiously and non-committally in a delicate emotional situation, showing measured restraint and emotional control.
Engages in tentative probing and careful dialogue to understand Eve’s feelings, indicating thoughtful interpersonal skills.
Shows some defensiveness and bitterness, reflecting internal conflict and self-accusation, which may undermine confidence.
Maintains composure and is able to soften and apologize sincerely despite tension, demonstrating emotional intelligence and social skill.
Smiles and engages warmly with Eve, touching her tenderly and looking at her with affection.
Responds with mild sarcasm or defensiveness when Eve critiques men like him, but quickly returns to playful affection.
Expresses sympathy and interest when Eve talks about her experience with Phillip Vandamm and the secret service.
Shows some distancing or dismissive attitude when he says 'Has life been like that?' in response to Eve's comment.
Responds to being 'shot' in the cafeteria with grace and a smile, acknowledging the situation lightly and showing self-awareness.
Admits he got involved in espionage 'by accident' and is not naturally skilled in that line of work, indicating a lack of deliberate preparation.
Displays emotional intelligence and sensitivity in his interactions with Eve, maintaining affection and wit despite tense circumstances.
Holds Eve close, expresses desire to stay with her longer, affirms loyalty ('Yours, always')
Shows concern for Eve's safety, reluctant to go to hospital and leave her in danger
Teases Eve about apologizing to each other, but in a sincere and caring manner

Holds Eve close, expresses confidence and emotional resilience despite danger, plans to undo bandages and confront challenges proactively.
Puzzled and unable to understand what Eve is trying to tell him about the Professor, indicating confusion or lack of awareness.
Holds onto Eve and expresses concern for her safety, shows emotional pain at betrayal, and opposes the Professor's manipulative plans.
Speaks bitterly and savagely to the Professor, expressing distrust and anger.
Catches up to Eve and tries to stop her from leaving.
Paces nervously and smokes in hospital room after violent incident, showing concern and agitation.
Attempts to stop Eve from driving away, actively tries to intervene.
Turns immediately when tapped on the back but is knocked out unexpectedly.
Falls to the ground after being hit and does not prevent the attack.
In hospital room, paces nervously and angrily smokes, showing distress and frustration rather than calm problem-solving.
Thanks the Professor politely after being given a new shirt.
Pretends he deserved being hit by the driver, showing a self-deprecating but friendly attitude.
Admits to acting childish and discusses personal feelings about a woman, showing some sincerity.
Turns away from the Professor with an expression showing ulterior motives.
Quickly and with noticeable cunning, lies down on the bed to conceal himself as footsteps and a key approach the locked door.
Tries the doorknob despite knowing it is locked, then hits at the door impatiently as though it were his enemy, showing frustration and lack of effective problem-solving.
Engages in polite and controlled conversation with the Professor, manages his response to injury with humor and pretense, indicating emotional resilience and social skill.
Admits to having been acting childish but turns away with an expression suggesting ulterior motives, indicating strategic thinking and self-awareness.
Smiles and cooperates amicably with the Professor, agreeing to share a drink and maintain friendly interaction.
Immediately loses his friendly smile once the Professor leaves and prepares to escape, indicating distrust and guarded behavior.
Expresses disgust and frustration at being locked in, calling the Professor a 'dirty sneak', showing quick judgment and lack of tolerance.
Softly says 'Excuse me' as he passes the woman in the hospital room, respecting her immediate request to stop but then walking away from her invitation.
Walks away from the woman's invitation without hostility or rudeness, showing polite disengagement.

Moves cautiously and silently through an unknown place, respects the warning to stop but proceeds politely and confidently, opens the door and walks out when invited, declines extra taxi assistance to proceed on his own, explores the area carefully, observes surroundings stealthily.
Hides quickly and cautiously when he sees the approaching car and people, then climbs the cantilever to observe.
Notices the hidden landing strip and observes it carefully.
Hears approaching car and quickly ducks beneath the house to hide.
Decides to climb up the cantilever beam to get a view inside the house.
Moves with cat-like stealth along a cantilever outside a window, takes up a hidden position, and peers inside to observe without being detected.
Glances sharply to detect surroundings and notices when Leonard approaches the window.
Uses a coin to try to attract Eve's attention when no pebble is available, demonstrating resourcefulness.
Ducks back into shadows to avoid detection when Leonard moves towards the window, showing situational awareness and caution.
Unable to signal Eve effectively, as his attempts only trigger her briefly before she walks away without understanding, indicating limited effectiveness in communication under pressure.
Glances toward the living-room window with widened eyes, attentive to unfolding events.
Attempts to signal Eve from the window but cannot move to do so.
Glances toward the living-room window and notices Leonard's movement and the hidden gun, demonstrating alertness and observation.
Listens carefully to the conversation between Leonard and Vandamm, showing patience and attentiveness.

Decides to climb precariously up the side of the house to reach Eve’s bedroom despite physical risk and pain from cuts.
Silently opens the window and enters Eve’s room; catches his breath and tends to his wound before proceeding cautiously.
Decides to climb precariously up the side of the house despite clear danger, showing determination and physical skill.

Successfully reaches the window sill and gets a view through the closed window, demonstrating problem-solving and perseverance.
After the lights go out, silently works the window open and cautiously enters the room, showing careful judgment and the ability to adapt.
Stares dejectedly through the glass before opening the window, showing a moment of hesitation or emotional reaction.
Climbs cautiously into the room despite injury and watches silently, showing concern and careful observation.
Writes a warning message to Eve to alert her of danger, using ingenuity to protect her.
Feels alarm and desperation when hearing approaching danger, showing emotional responsiveness.
Notices the approaching danger (the sound of the drone), quickly formulates a plan to warn Eve by writing a discreet message on the match folder, and proceeds cautiously to try to deliver it.
Is limited by his unfavorable vantage point and cannot see much of the room, indicating a situational disadvantage, but nevertheless acts decisively.
Urgently whispers to Eve to escape through the window, tries to protect her by warning and urging quick action.
Grabs Eve and pulls her toward the window without her consent, despite her resistance.
Calls out to Eve not to get on the plane and promises to get the car, showing concern for her safety.
Quickly suggests escaping through the window and points out a car downstairs to make a swift getaway.
Urgently informs Eve about Leonard discovering the gum and the fake shooting, showing awareness of critical plot details.
Warns Eve not to get on the plane and promises to get the car, demonstrating initiative and protective responsibility.
Eve calls him an idiot for trying to rush an escape that could ruin everything, suggesting his plan may be reckless or poorly judged.
Cautiously steps forward and looks out the balcony, showing awareness and restraint.
Moves quickly along the balcony and down the stairs after the housekeeper leaves, indicating alertness but no direct interaction.
Looks desperately toward the exit door after being told to sit by the armed housekeeper.
Fails to escape or take immediate action despite the threat from the housekeeper and the chance that Mr. Leonard and her husband will return soon.
Maintains composure and sits calmly when ordered at gunpoint instead of panicking.

Yells to lock the car door to protect Eve and drives away aggressively to escape pursuers.
Tugs frantically at the locked gates to keep pursuers away, showing protective concern.

Jumps out to try pulling chains off locked gates to gain access.
Acknowledges housekeeper pinned him down for five minutes before realizing her identity.
Takes the figure from Eve to help carry her burden and protect her.
Stops and struggles with Eve to free her scarf caught on a tree before continuing to run.
Takes the figure from Eve to ease her burden, helping her move faster.
Stops to help Eve untangle her scarf caught on a pine tree, working together to escape.
Acknowledges their compromised position upon reaching the top of the monument and assesses the situation.
Grabs Eve's arm and starts running with her toward safety, acting decisively in a tense situation.
Encourages Eve to descend the dangerous slope despite her hesitation, showing determination and concern for both their safety.
Grabs Eve's arm and starts running with her decisively toward the only escape route available.
Persists in climbing down a dangerous face despite Eve's hesitation, showing resolve and willingness to take calculated physical risks.
Proposes a joint train trip with Eve if they escape alive, indicating a desire for companionship and trust.
Shares personal information about his failed marriages and self-judgment on being dull, showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Initially reluctant to share the story ('Skip it'), which could suggest guardedness.
Encourages Eve to lighten her load for safety, showing concern for her well-being during a dangerous situation.
Responds sourly to Eve's attempt at humor despite danger, showing a brief moment of irritability.
Quickly recognizes the practical hindrance of Eve's shoes, jacket, and handbag during a chase and instructs her to discard them to move faster.
Stumbles precariously while descending the ledge, showing some physical awkwardness or lack of surefootedness.
Responds to Eve's humor with a dry, somewhat sour remark, displaying situational awareness but limited emotional adaptability in stress.
Remembers he forgot to register while in a high-pressure escape, indicating mental distraction or forgetfulness under stress.
Rushes to rescue Eve from a perilous fall, risking his own safety to save her.
Calls out to Leonard desperately, pleading for help to save Eve.
Recoils in tension and pain but tries to encourage Eve to keep trying despite dangerous circumstances.
Applies weight deliberately to fingers under pressure despite pain, showing physical endurance and presence of mind.
Glances at the smashed figure and microfilm, then looks up, indicating situational awareness.
Expresses struggle verbally under extreme pain, gasping and finding it hard to continue.
Encourages Eve with supportive words during physical effort.
Lifts Eve with difficulty so she can be comfortable in the train berth.
